content:
We've added a bit of text to the PR lifecycle page about the "easy" label on mathlib PRs.

The easy label should be used to mark PRs that can be immediately approved. Maintainers often look at easy PRs first to keep the queue flowing. Easy PRs typically add a single lemma, correct typos in documentation, or similar. If you have any doubt whether your PR is trivial you should not add this label. In particular, a PR is generally not easy if the diff is more than 25 lines, it adds any definitions or new files, or it adds any simp lemmas or instances that are not immediately analogous to existing simp lemmas or instances.

Summary: please be cautious about adding this label! Only add if if you're pretty sure that we'll merge the PR within 20 seconds of looking at it.

Should we refrain from tagging things "easy" until they pass CI? Or is it fine for tag things pre-emptively with the reading "if this doesn't pass CI then the fix will be trivial too, so a bors d+ is still reasonable"

I think it doesn't matter too much how PRs that are still building are tagged since the #queue link that we use only includes PRs which pass CI.
Whoops, that's wrong. But I still don't think it matters too much.
Also, it would make sense to put some mention of these guidelines for "easy" in the label description on github
Perhaps "< 20s of review time. See the lifecycle page for guidelines" since I think label descriptions have to be short
@Eric Wieser I've added your description to the label, thanks!
I have recently tagged as "easy" two of my PRs: I was really sure that they were easy, but they failed the 20s rule. Sorry about that!
No worries! It's an evolving thing... the rule didn't exist yet when you did that (-;

Just a reminder that the "easy" label on GitHub indicates "< 20s of review time". Obviously this is subjective but I think I've seen quite a few PRs adopting a fairly optimistic interpretation of what I can achieve in 20s recently.
I'm not sure, that might suggest "I need this reviewed quickly" to somebody. I think "easy" mostly works just fine, I just wanted to mention this thread briefly.
do we have a label for time-sensitive PRs that have frequent merge conflicts? That's "quick" in a different sense
We don't have such a label. I make no objection to adding one but I doubt that a GitHub label is the right medium for getting something done urgently.
If we ever make such an urgent label, we ought to be careful. I'm pretty sure everyone thinks their contributions are urgent in some sense!
urgent PRs are also usually big (hence the higher chance of conflict)
